comments:
This is the second of a two-semester sophomore level laboratory sequence for MEAM. The course teaches the principles of experimentation and measurement as well as analysis and application to design. The spring semester course follows closely with MEAM 203 and MEAM 211, expanding upon the principles of experimentation, measurement, analysis, and design of systems through hands-on laboratories and projects in thermodynamics and dynamics.

Most students felt that this course was “excellent,” “very enjoyable,” and “hands-on.” However, some students felt the lab was too “repetitive.”

Professor Fiene had a “very hands off” teaching style that is beneficial to students who “prefer learning on their own.” However, some students felt that the TAs were “particularly helpful.”

Students overall agreed that the course “required a lot of work” and involved frequent “team-based” assignments.
